Context:
The text describes a graduate certificate program in machine technology offered by the college for recent graduates in engineering and skilled trades, international professionals, and industry professionals with relevant certifications. The program provides flexible learning options for individuals currently employed full-time. The graduates of this program will find employment in various advanced manufacturing sectors such as fabricated metal, machinery, motor vehicle parts, and aerospace manufacturing.

The required courses for the graduate certificate are divided into two semesters:

Semester 1:
- EMNG1004: Metrology
- MENG1041: Tool Fabrication
- MENG1042: Engineering Drawing and Mechanical CAD
- MENG1043: CNC Programming
- CADE1013: CNC Machining Practices
- MENG1088: Occupational Health and Safety

Semester 2:
- CADE2034: Advanced CNC Machining
- MENG2041: Precision Tool Manufacturing
- CADE2013: Advanced Computer-Aided Manufacturing
- DRFT2024: Tool Design
- MENG2061: Career Preparation

The program learning outcomes include the ability to assemble and analyze information using advanced CAD and CNC software, collaborate with team members, analyze and solve manufacturing problems, interpret and modify mechanical drawings, complete work in compliance with standard operating procedures, and contribute to production processes.
file_path: scraped_pages/programpages2023/Advanced Manufacturing Program T414 | George Brown College2023.txt

Context:
Program Information:
- The college offers production processes to manufacture components according to customer requirements.
- Quality control and quality assurance procedures are applied to meet organizational standards and requirements.
- Components are manufactured using CNC machines and cutting-edge technologies to customer specifications.
- Ongoing strategies for personal, career and professional development are developed and applied.

Tuition Fees:
- Domestic tuition for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2022 is $6,752.
- International tuition for the first two semesters of programs starting in Fall 2023 is $18,178.
- Additional costs are subject to change and do not include material or textbooks.
- Financial assistance is available for this program through OSAP, but applicants must meet eligibility criteria.

Admission Requirements:
- Applicants need an Ontario College Diploma, Ontario College Advanced Diploma, Degree or equivalent in Mechanical Engineering or Mechanical Engineering Technology.
- International students with non-English transcripts need to test at the college level in the George Brown College English assessment for admission.

Application Process:
- Domestic students should apply through Ontario Colleges.
- International students should apply through the George Brown College Online Application System.

Contact Information:
- School of Mechanical Engineering Technologies: Phone: 416-415-5000, ext. 4365, Email: engineeringtech@georgebrown.ca, Room D305.
- For more information about George Brown College, contact the college using the provided phone number or email address.
